citeinfo.title: Bedrock Geology of Rhode Island; s44gbr95

pubinfo.pubplace: University of Rhode Island, Department of Geosciences, Kingston, RI 02881

citeinfo.othercit: Suggested bibliographic reference: RIGIS, 1994. Bedrock Geology of Rhode Island; s44gbr95. Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) Data Distribution System, URL: http://www.rigis.org, Environmental Data Center, University of Rhode Island, Kingston, Rhode Island (last date accessed: 30 September 2014).

descript.abstract: Much new geologic data has been accumulated since A. Quinn published the Rhode Island Geologic Map in 1971. This dataset incorporates recent data. It is presented in digital format at a scale of 1:100,000.
descript.purpose: The 1994 published Geologic Map of Rhode Island was made from the digital data contained here. The compiled digital database provides users with complete GIS capabilities. The coding of the topology is designed to permit easy use and manipulation of geologic information in the database by the user.

idinfo.useconst: Data for this map was compiled at a scale of 1:100,000 for the sole purpose of publishing a 1:100,000 scale bedrock geologic map. Analyses and interpretation for regulatory purposes should not be done at this expanded scale . Compilers and originators of this map are not liable for use outside of its intended purpose. This dataset is provided 'as is.â€™ The producer(s) of this dataset, contributors to this dataset, the Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) consortium, the State of Rhode Island, and the University of Rhode Island do not make any warranties of any kind for this dataset, and are not liable for any loss or damage however and whenever caused by any use of this dataset. Please acknowledge both RIGIS and the primary producer(s) of this dataset in any derived products. Versions of the RIGIS logo suitable for both printed and web-based products are available at http://www.rigis.org/logos.

cntperp.cntorg: University of Rhode Island, Department of Geosciences

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770

attracc.attraccr: Created attributes are consistent in both thematic database and the spatial coverage.

dataqual.logic: No specific test were performed. However data are thought to be logically consistent because attribute information for the same spatial entities were read from the same source file.
dataqual.complete: Geologic boundaries were digitized from stable Mylar at a map scale of 1:100,000. Shoreline, lakes and pond boundaries are from United States Geological Survey DLG files that were digitized at a scale of 1:100,000.

horizpa.horizpar: Most geologic boundaries originated from 1:24,000 and 1:31,680 quadrangle geologic maps. After generalizing these boundaries to a scale of 1:100,000 , they were scribed on a stable Mylar base. These boundaries were then digitized in Arc/Info using a Calcomp9100 digitizer.

citeinfo.title: Bedrock geologic Map of Rhode Island

pubinfo.pubplace: University of Rhode Island, Department of Geosciences, Kingston, RI 02881

srcinfo.srccontr: Vector data represent geological units and boundaries

procstep.procdesc: Most geologic boundaries originated from 1:24,000 and 1:31,000 quadrangle geologic maps. After generalizing these boundaries for the scale of 1:100,000 , they were scribed on a stable Mylar base. These boundaries were then digitized in Arc/Info using a Calcomp9100 digitizer with RMS =< 005. Shoreline, lakes and pond boundaries were copied from United Geological Survey 1:100,000 scale DLG files. Both geologic boundaries and units attributes are coded. The coding of the topology is designed to allow easy manipulation of geological information in the database by users.

cntperp.cntorg: University of Rhode Island, Department of Geosciences

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Subunit of the Esmond-Dedham subterrane area

overview.eaover: Extensive definitions of these attributes are available from the following: Hermes, O.D., L.P. Gromet, and D.P. Murray, 1994. Bedrock Geologic Map of Rhode Island. Office of the State Geologist, Department of Geology, University of Rhode Island, Kingston, Rhode Island.
